page.title: 01Dalmeny
page.content: This is a rural area, the bulk of which is worked by a number of tenant farmers who lease their farms from the local estate owners. There are only two residential pockets both to the north of the block, the larger one comprising apart of the town of South Queensferry from which the road climbs to the other, the small village of Dalmeny The village boats an ancient Norman Church, a small general store a subpost office and a modern school. Only a few village children attend the 3 techer school as most of the population are old age pensioners. From the school windows on the south side, sheep can be seen grazing on what was once an old shale mine nad is now an oil storage depot. The dual carriageway bringing traffic from the city of Edinburgh to cross
